sub_title: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam
summary:
Izabela holds a Master’s degree from the Faculty of Civil Engineering at the Warsaw University of
Technology. Izabela has worked in Buro Happold for almost eleven years, during which she has
been engaged with a wide range of local and international projects including Dworzec Wileński
Metro Station, Q22, Generation Park in Warsaw, Fish and Vegetable Market in Oman, Polish Embassy
in Berlin, Battersea Power Station in London, west Kowloon Terminus in Hong Kong. In 2019 she became chartered engineer with Polish
Chamber of Civil Engineers. 

Izabela is passionate about structural modelling and is always keen on finding innovative engineering solutions. Thanks to excellent interpersonal skills she is able to build good relations with coworkers. What is more, Izabela gladly shares her knowledge and experience in software usage with colleagues in office.

projects.title: Y Towers
projects.description:
Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands 

Client: Rizzani de Eccher (General contractor) /Union Investment (Investor)
Architect: Team V Architectuur

Y-Towers is one of Amsterdam’s most spectacular large-scale development projects, which is transforming the skyline of the Overhoeks development zone in the north of the city.

Buro Happold has been engaged as a trusted advisor to bring insight and consultancy around pre-existing designs, with a brief to optimise the project around a range of disciplines, including structures, facades, acoustics and MEP.

Izabela took a role as Design Coordinator and Head of Structural Engineering, supporting Rizzani de Eccher, the Italian general contractor of Y Towers in Amsterdam.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Museum
projects.description:
Location: Saudi Arabia

Client: Confidential
Architect: Confidential

Museum in Saudi Arabia is a complex of buildings with ma height around 30 m above ground and two basement levels with total footprint of appr. 17.000 m2. Main structure designed as reinforced concrete with steel roofs structure. Design Development and Technical Design stages have been done according to Saudi and American Codes.

Izabela has joined the project during Design Development stage and was responsible for the design as well as for coordination process between international design team members and architects.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Generation Park
projects.description:
Location: Warsaw, Poland

Client: Skanska Property Poland	
Architect: JEMS Architekci
Project value: 150 mln €

Generation Park will be the tri-building, high class office complex from Skanska Property Poland. Designed by the JEMS Architekci studio, it will be located next to Rondo Daszyńskiego in the heart of Warsaw business centre. BuroHappold will provide structural, mechanical, electrical and plumbing engineering, construction design sustainability consulting and LEED certification.

Iza has joined the project from concept to executive design stage and she was involved in structural calculations (RC structures including foundation slab) and preparing executive documentation also in coordination with subcontractors, preparing formal documents to obtaining agreements from Metro Warszawskie and other authorities.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Factory Building
projects.description:
Location: China

Client: Confidential
Architect: Confidential

Factory in China, total footprint of appr. 166 481 m2. Steel structure with 18,75 m span trusses. Concept Design as well as Preliminary Design stage have been done according to Chinese Code.

Izabela was responsible was the design of the steel structures as well as for contact with architects. She also took part in workshops with Local Design Institute and the Client to provide quality for the Detail Design stage.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: West Kowloon Terminus
projects.description:
Location: Hong Kong, China

Client: Mass Transit Railway
Architect: Aedas

The West Kowloon Terminus is an underground station located immediately north of the proposed
West Kowloon Cultural District, close to Lantau Airport Railway Station and Kowloon Southern Link
Austin Station. This is also the most southern terminus of the national high speed rail network. West
Kowloon Terminus is destined to become a major gateway to the Chinese mainland.

BuroHappold Engineering’s scope of work primarily related to the above ground work, with a
particular focus on designing the iconic roof. This enormous free form structure accommodates a
vast central space while providing natural light and views of Hong Kong Island.

During her secondment in Hong Kong between November 2015 and May 2015, Iza worked as a member of a team located on site.
She was responsible for preparing reports and calculations verifying steel roof structure according to
local codes. It was an excellent opportunity to gain experience on high-complicated steel structure project with
parametric-designed geometry, requiring also advanced Excel’s spreadsheets based on VBA coding.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Battersea Power Station Development Phase 3
projects.description:
Location: London, UK

Client: Battersea Power Station Development
Architect: Foster and Partners

BuroHappold has been appointed by the Battersea Power Station Development Company to provide
multidisciplinary engineering design and consultancy to the redevelopment of Battersea Power
Station. Configured to compliment the famous brick power station, the project will feature a high
street, coined ‘the electric boulevard’, that will serve as a gateway, connecting the northern line
underground extension station with the 42-acre site. Over 1,3000 residential units, a 160-room hotel, and 350,000 square feet of retail and dining space is articulated around the pedestrianized avenue, ensuring a vibrant streetscape. 

Iza has joined the project at stage D and she was responsible for building analytical models of the building in development zone 0-1 and structural calculations of vertical elements. The complex geometry gave opportunity to use new technologies in modeling.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Dworzec Wileński Metro Station
projects.description:
Location: Warsaw, Poland

Client: City of Warsaw
Architect: Client Consortium Astaldi, Gülermak and PBDiM

The construction of this second metro line involved the major redevelopment of the city centre
transport infrastructure to meet Warsaw’s growing needs. The new line comprises 7 new stations
along 6.1km of track, 600m of which runs under the Vistula River. The project was co-financed by
the EU’s Cohesion Fund, as part of the Infrastructure and Environment programme. BuroHappold
provided structural engineering and building services solutions for Dworzec Wileński station, which
also houses the largest retail complex on the new line. 

Iza has joined the project at executive design stage and she was involved in structural calculations and preparing an executive documentation also in coordination with subcontractors.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Fish and Vegetable Market
projects.description:
Location: Muscat, Oman

Client: City of Muscat
Architect: Snohetta

The new fish market complex in Muscat, the capital city of Oman is designed by Snohetta, this highprofile project in the heart of the city will be a new waterfront landmark and will replace the existing 1960’s building with modern trading spaces and will feature landing, refrigeration, preparation, packing and restaurant facilities. The public space is enhanced by a dynamic shaded canopy covering organised spaces beneath. There is a curved wall that defines the northern spine of the new fish market, which is constructed of rammed earth, a structure, which is both sustainable and reminiscant of traditional venacular architecture familiar to the local community. 

Iza has joined the project at executive design stage and she was involved in structural calculations (steel structures) and preparing executive documentation. She coped with ARSA’s limitations related to using custom steel sections of compound columns.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam

projects.title: Q22
projects.description:
Location: Warsaw, Poland

Client: Echo Investment
Architect: Kuryłowicz & Associates
Project value: 120 mln €

Designed by the famous Polish architectural office, Kuryłowicz & Associates, and commissioned by leading Polish investor Echo, this 155 metre tall high rise will offer 40,000m2 of leasable office space. The building will be located in the business centre of Warsaw, on the site of the demolished Mercure Hotel. BuroHappold was appointed to provide structural engineering, building services engineering, sustainability consulting and BREEAM certification for this ambitious project.

Iza took part in the project from concept to executive design stage and she was involved in structural calculations (RC and steel structures) and preparing an executive documentation also in coordination with subcontractors.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam
Head of Structures at SSH Design

projects.title: The Republic of Poland Embassy In Berlin
projects.description:
Location: Berlin, Germany

Client: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Poland
Architect: JEMS Architekci

The new Polish Embassy in Berlin is located in the heart of the city, on the historic boulevard Unter
den Linden. JEMS Architekci’s vision was to deliver a building that was both iconic and harmonious
with its surroundings, which include the eminent Government District and the Brandenburg
Gate. BuroHappold’s Warsaw and Berlin teams worked in close collaboration to provide structural,
mechanical, electrical and plumbing engineering, as well as construction design. 

Iza has joined the project at building permit design stage (design for approval, i.e. phase 4 according to German HOAI) and she was responsible for preparing structural documentation and calculations according to Germans standards. Beside that her role was to cooperate directly with the architect and also to coordinate subcontractors.

contributors.headline: Associate & Learning Ambassador | Structures | Buro Happold Rotterdam
